intro: Polygonum minus var. erectum, commonly known as redroot pigweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features erect, branching stems that are reddish in color. The leaves are lance-shaped, with a rough texture and a reddish or purplish hue on the underside. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, three-angled seeds. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural fields.
